data_findings.finding: This is a 2D packing optimization problem: pack Christmas tree shapes (15-vertex polygons) into smallest square bounding box for N=1 to 200 trees. Score = sum(side^2/N) for all N. Lower is better. Target: 68.931058
Key optimizer: bbox3 binary - runs with -n (iterations) and -r (parameter). Used by top kernels. Typical params: -n 1000-10000, -r 4-256
fix_direction optimization: Rotates entire configuration to minimize bounding box using scipy.optimize.minimize_scalar on convex hull. Multiple passes improve results.
Overlap repair: When bbox3 creates overlaps, replace those N configurations with known good ones from donor file
Santa Claude kernel: C++ optimizer with simulated annealing, local search, compaction, squeeze, swap moves, multi-start. Also has backward propagation (removing trees from N to improve N-1 configs)
